rules.natural: If the research project receives government grant funding, then the clinical trial does not use the digital monitoring platform.
Either the pharmaceutical corporation acquires the research team, or if the research team develops a portable drug dispenser device, then the research project receives government grant funding.
If the research team publishes results in a peer-reviewed journal, then the experimental drug completes development.
If the research team presents findings at a medical conference, then the experimental drug completes development.
If the research team secures a patent for the drug formula, then the research team publishes results in a peer-reviewed journal.
Either the research team secures a patent for the drug formula, or the research team forms a partnership with a university laboratory.
If the research team forms a partnership with a university laboratory, then the research team presents findings at a medical conference.
If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the clinical trial uses the digital monitoring platform.
If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the research team develops a portable drug dispenser device.

facts.natural: The research team has FDA authorization approval.
The pharmaceutical corporation does not acquire the research team.

(A1 → G).natural: If the research team has FDA authorization approval, then the experimental drug completes development.

(A3 → ¬A2).natural: If the research project receives government grant funding, then the clinical trial does not use the digital monitoring platform.

(A4 → A3).natural: If the research team develops a portable drug dispenser device, then the research project receives government grant funding.

(A5 ∨ (A4 → A3)).natural: Either the pharmaceutical corporation acquires the research team, or if the research team develops a portable drug dispenser device, then the research project receives government grant funding.

(A6 → G).natural: If the research team publishes results in a peer-reviewed journal, then the experimental drug completes development.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: Either the research team publishes results in a peer-reviewed journal, or the research team presents findings at a medical conference.

(A7 → G).natural: If the research team presents findings at a medical conference, then the experimental drug completes development.

(A8 → A6).natural: If the research team secures a patent for the drug formula, then the research team publishes results in a peer-reviewed journal.

(A8 ∨ A9).natural: Either the research team secures a patent for the drug formula, or the research team forms a partnership with a university laboratory.

(A9 → A7).natural: If the research team forms a partnership with a university laboratory, then the research team presents findings at a medical conference.

(¬(A1 → G) → A2).natural: If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the clinical trial uses the digital monitoring platform.

(¬(A1 → G) → A3).natural: If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the research project receives government grant funding.

(¬(A1 → G) → A4).natural: If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the research team develops a portable drug dispenser device.

(¬(A1 → G) → ¬A2).natural: If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the clinical trial does not use the digital monitoring platform.

A1.natural: The research team has FDA authorization approval.

¬A5.natural: The pharmaceutical corporation does not acquire the research team.
